  \subsection{Functions}

    \label{Operations:DotDataFunctions:datahstack:datahstack}
    \index{Operations \textit{(package)}!Operations.DotDataFunctions \textit{(package)}!Operations.DotDataFunctions.datahstack \textit{(module)}!Operations.DotDataFunctions.datahstack.datahstack \textit{(function)}}

    \vspace{0.5ex}

\hspace{.8\funcindent}\begin{boxedminipage}{\funcwidth}

    \raggedright \textbf{datahstack}(\textit{ListOfDatas})

    \vspace{-1.5ex}

    \rule{\textwidth}{0.5\fboxrule}
\setlength{\parskip}{2ex}
    For "horizontal stacking" DotDatas, e.g. adding columns. Requires all 
    DotDatas to have same number of records. If column appears to two 
    DotDatas in ListOfDats, first is taken.

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
    \end{boxedminipage}

    \label{Operations:DotDataFunctions:datahstack:SafeColumnStack}
